snippet: It turns out the can’t-miss star who misses the N.B.A. can make a fair living in Algiers, or in Halifax, Canada.
abstract: Michael Powell Sports of The Times column; Rucker Park in the South Bronx, once a symbol of New York City hoops, has become emblematic of basketball's globalization; Zaire Taylor, a regular at Rucker, was voted most valuable player of Worcester Wolves, and recently jumped to London Lions, enjoying a comfortable globetrotting career despite having put his NBA dreams aside.
lead_paragraph: It turns out the can’t-miss star who misses the N.B.A. can make a fair living in Algiers, or in Halifax, Canada.

headline.seo: Rucker Park Stars Set Their N.B.A. Dreams Aside and Head Abroad
headline.main: A Symbol of City Hoops, and Now Globalization
headline.print_headline: A Symbol of City Hoops, and Globalization
